intro: Polygala exigua, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family, which includes a variety of herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Its small, delicate flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, bead-like fruits. Polygala exigua is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
